handDesc.handNote: The handwriting tends to right-sloping. The letters are slender and narrowly spaced.

list.item:
Fol. 71vb: Donation note.
The note is written in a mediocre hand. The part containing the name of the original donor and the receiving institution has been erased.

Fol. 72ra-b: Donation note. Fol. 72ra: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘወሐቦ፡ ለኢየሱስ፡ ዘሥላሴ፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ሩፋኤል
The note is written in a poor hand, the same as Additio 3. It states that Zä-Śǝllase and his wife Wälättä Rufaʾel donated the Ms. to the church of ʾIyäsus.

Fol. 72ra-b: Ownership note extended by a record concerning the construction of a church. Fol. 72ra-b: ዝንቱ፡ ድርሳን፡ ዘመድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፡ ወኅንፀተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክ{ር}ስቲያኑኒ፡ ኮነ፡ በ፲፻ወ፰፻፺ወ፬ቱ፡ አመ{ተ}፡ ምሕረት፡ዘመኑሂ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ወንጉሡኒ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ነገሥት፡ ምኒልክ፡ መምሕሩኒ፡ መምህር፡ ወልደ፡ ዐቢየ፡ እግዚእ፡ አፈ፡ መምሕሩኒ፡ አለቃ፡ አሥራት
The note is written in a poor hand, the same as Additio 2. It mentions that the donation of the Ms. and the construction of the church of the Saviour of the World (possibly in the vicinity of ʾIyäsus Gwaḥgot, s. D.NOSNITSIN, Churches and Monasteries of Tǝgray, Wiesbaden 2013, or in ʾAqaqi near Addis Ababa, s. GueCopMen, vol. 2, p. 524) took place in 1894 year of mercy (= 1901/02 A.D.), in the year of Mark the Evangelist, during the reign of King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913), when the teacher was mämhǝr Wäldä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʿ and his assistant was ʾaläqa ʾAśrat.

Fol. 72v: Record concerning the acquisition of land and the introduction of a new tabot.Fol. 72v: ለመድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፡ የተተካ፡ መሬት፡ ፬፡ ነው፡ ግራ[ት]፡ ምሸላ፡ ከአቶ፡ ይረስ፡ ያለች፡ ከአቶ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ደሞ፡ ያለች፡ ደሞ፡ ከአቶ፡ ሐጐስ፡ ያለች፡ ፬፡ ማለታችን፡ ይኅ፡ ነው፡…
The note is written in Amharic, in a mediocre hand. It states that there are four plots of land with sorghum donated by four individuals (mentioned by name) for (the commemoration of ?) the Saviour of the World. One of the plots should be allocated as a salary for a deacon. Subsequently, it contains a directive which requires that if a new tabot is introduced, it should be dedicated to St George.

- An unfinished (historiographic ?) note or pen trial, በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ቴዎድሮስ:... fol. 1r. - A note of several lines has been erased in fol. 72ra. - Pen trial: fol. 72ra. - Scribbles, writing exercises (part of Ethiopic syllabary), doodles: fols. 1r, 72rb, inner face of the front board.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered by reddish-brown leather (for the most part hidden under the secondary textile cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes are visible in the centrefold of the quires. The secondary textile cover is attached to the boards by means of recent synthetic threads.

origin.origDate: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was donated to the church of ʾIyäsus in 1894 year of mercy (= 1901/02 A.D.).

person.persName: The name of the original donor(s) was probably written in the erased part of Additio 1 and in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. According to Additio 2, Zä-Śǝllase donated the Ms. to the church of ʾIyäsus (Gwaḥgot) in 1901/02. His name and the name of his wife Wälättä Rufaʾel are also written in the supplication formulas, over the erased name(s), in the same hand as Additio 2 (e.g., fols. 7ra, 32ra). Two other names, <...> Mikaʾel and his wife Ṣädalä Maryam, are added in some supplication formulas, in another secondary hand (e.g., fols. 25ra, 37va).
